name: py-mock
description:
mock is a library for testing in Python. It allows you to replace parts
of your system under test with mock objects and make assertions about
how they have been used.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pbr
dependencies.description:
PBR is a library that injects some useful and sensible default behaviors
into your setuptools run.

dependencies.name: py-funcsigs
dependencies.description: Python function signatures from PEP362 for Python 2.6, 2.7 and 3.2.

dependent_to.name: py-nose2
dependent_to.description: unittest2 with plugins, the succesor to nose

dependent_to.name: py-responses
dependent_to.description: A utility library for mocking out the `requests` Python library.

dependent_to.name: py-azure-identity
dependent_to.description: Microsoft Azure Identity Library for Python.

dependent_to.name: py-apache-beam
dependent_to.description: Apache Beam is a unified programming model for Batch and Streaming.

dependent_to.name: geopm
dependent_to.description:
GEOPM is an extensible power management framework targeting HPC. The
GEOPM package provides libgeopm, libgeopmpolicy and applications
geopmctl and geopmpolicy, as well as tools for postprocessing. GEOPM is
designed to be extended for new control algorithms and new hardware
power management features via its plugin infrastructure. Note: GEOPM
interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs). For
propper usage make sure MSRs are made available directly or via the msr-
safe kernel module by your administrator.

dependent_to.name: awscli
dependent_to.description:
This package provides a unified command line interface to Amazon Web
Services

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)

dependent_to.name: py-vsts-cd-manager
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper around some of the VSTS APIs.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow
dependent_to.description: TensorFlow is an Open Source Software Library for Machine Intelligence

dependent_to.name: ambari
dependent_to.description:
Apache Ambari is a tool for provisioning, managing, and monitoring
Apache Hadoop clusters. Ambari consists of a set of RESTful APIs and a
browser-based management interface.

dependent_to.name: py-gsutil
dependent_to.description: A command line tool for interacting with cloud storage services.
